entry.title: DevNTell - Corgis.xyz
entry.summary:
üåà GM In this week's episode of DevNTell, codewithcorgis (Drew) gives us an updated look at his project, Corgis.xyz: Corgis.xyz is looking to make code cute and informative! Maybe the way to teach your mom, dad, friends, or family what you do in web3. üåü Developer Spotlight Corgi Drew is a developer focused on education which focuses on making code accessible and making learning fun and interactive. He lives and breathes in teaching others tech. He makes fun learning materials, videos, and comics to break problems into visually animated chunks. Comes from a background in teaching data science and full-stack development but is on a journey to make the duolingo for tech. üê∂ About Corgis.xyz Corgis.xyz aspirations are to make code cute and informative! The intent is to make it easy for newcomers to learn and think like a coder by converting challenging concepts into comic-book-like lessons and playing interactive puzzle games. (Source) Website: https://www.corgis.xyz/ Twitter: https://twitter.com/codewithcorgis Medium: https://medium.com/codewithcorgis Insta: https://www.instagram.com/codewithcorgis/ üé• Presentation

entry.title: Technical Writing 101: 360 Guide on How to Start your Technical Writing Journey
entry.summary: You might have the impression that writers are born. But no, they are made! Writing is a skill you can learn, sharpen, and master through consistent practice over time. All it takes is good resources to learn and to write and read what other writers have written constantly. Lisa See says, "reading a thousand books will make your words flow like a river". Are you a lover of emerging technologies, someone who likes to explain things in a way that even a 6-year-old baby can understand? Or are you a developer who loves to share ideas and teach people via written content? Then technical writing is for you. So, let's get started! What Makes a Technical Writer? A technical writer is a person who writes company documents such as user manuals, reference guides, business plans, legal disclaimers, op‚Ä¶

entry.title: The Difference Between Alchemy API and thirdweb SDK?
entry.summary: As a software or web developer, you will work with different components, some of which you will use more often, like application programming interfaces (APIs) and software development kits (SDKs) mainly because developers are keen to improve the software development cycles. In modern-day software development, APIs and SDKs have become essential parts; because they have so much in common, they often get mixed up. In my opinion, in the first half of 2022, we had an uptrend in Developer Experience (DX), while User Experience (UX) dominated the second half. APIs and SDKs play an essential part in improving both experiences. A well-known SDK is Google SDK for analytics which developers use to get data about user behaviours. We also have Facebook SDK for advertising, which makes it easier for de‚Ä¶

entry.title: DevNTell - Cypherock
entry.summary:
üåà GM In this week's episode of DevNTell, DAO member Naman Seth gives us an overview of Cypherock: the worlds first hardware wallet without a seedphrase backup üåü Developer Spotlight Naman joined Web3 back in 2017, degened his way through the space for 4 years while being a freelance marketer. Naman is currently leading BD at Cypherock. üöÄ About Cypherock Cypherock is a Consensys-backed startup, building the worlds first hardware wallet without a seedphrase backup. The current issues with key management pose massive barriers to the adoption of decentralized technologies. Cypherock believes digital assets will have exponentially more value in the future and that will just not be limited to Cryptocurrency. Cypherock's mission is to empower people to be self-sovereign and to have the same peace of mind and control with their crypto and personal data that they have with their savings in the bank vaults. [Source] Website: https://cypherock.com Twitter: https://twitter.com/CypherockWallet GitHub: https://github.com/cypherock Naman's NFTd: https://nf.td/nmnsth Naman's Twitter: https://twitter.com/nmnsth üé• Presentation
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Uq_Kx3-UTdE

entry.title: Create NFT Smart Contract with thirdweb and Chainlink
entry.summary: In this tutorial, we will build a custom ERC-721 NFT collection using thirdweb and Chainlink. We will use thirdweb ContractKit for the ERC-721 token standard, thirdweb deploy to deploy our smart contract to Mumbai Testnet, and Chainlink Data Feeds to fetch the realtime price of Matic to set the base price for minting NFT. We will build and deploy a smart contract that allows users to mint NFT. The user has to pay at least $1 in Matic to mint the NFT. We get the actual price conversion using Chainlink Data Feeds. What is ERC-721? ERC-721 is a free, open standard that describes how to build non-fungible or unique tokens on the Ethereum blockchain. While most tokens are fungible (every token is the same as every other token), ERC-721 tokens are all unique. The ERC-721 introduces a standard fo‚Ä¶

entry.title: DevNTell - Storedat.io
entry.summary:
üåà GM In this week's episode of DevNTell, Developer DAO member Narb gives us an overview of his new venture called Storedat: Web3 storage made easy üåü Developer Spotlight If you'd like to learn a bit about Narb you can check out the following resources: Introductory blog post: https://narb.hashnode.dev/narb-a-web3-story Humans of D_D Podcast:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tm5lgiYHH2E
üß† About Storedat Storedat is a GraphQL API built on top of existing web3 storage providers like Arweave and Filecoin. We exist to accelerate the adoption of decentralized storage by providing a provider agnostic way to read and write data with those protocols all the while abstracting away web3 from the user. No dealing with wallets, signing transactions, storing private keys, paying transaction costs, and so on. Just plug in and Storedat Resources: Website: https://storedat.io Sign up for the Beta: https://auth.storedat.io Docs: https://docs.storedat.io API Playground: https://perma.storedat.io/api/v1/graphql Starter template: https://github.com/Glosseta/storedat-api-starter-template Twitter: https://www.twitter.com/storedat_io Glosseta Foundation: https://www.glosseta.foundation üé• Presentation
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ULpuwe108FY
